intro: Argostemma parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
